summary: Parthenium hysterophorus is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the American tropics. Common names include Santa-Maria, Santa Maria feverfew, whitetop weed, and famine weed. In India, it is locally known as carrot grass, congress grass or Gajar Ghas or Dhanura. It is a common invasive species in India, Australia, and parts of Africa.

flower.description: Head flowers 3-6 mm in diameter. About 40 ornamental flowers in the center of the head flower are male flowers, and 5 tongue flowers on the edge are female flowers.

shape.stem: Stand upright, branch from above. have hair
shape.leaf: The outline is ovate or elliptical, with 2 pinnate lobes, 8-20 cm long and 4-5 cm wide, and the upper one gradually becomes smaller.
shape.fruit: It is obovate, 1-1.5mm long, flat, with two spoon-shaped appendages on the top, and the color of the fruit is black.
